recipe.name: Papoutsakia
recipe.description: A traditional Greek dish that tastes very similar to moussaka, but is much quicker to cook. Fun fact: Papoutsakia in Greek means "little shoes"!

recipe.name: Gambas al Ajilo

step.description: In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with 1 teaspoon of kosher salt and let stand for 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, in a 9- to 10-inch enameled cast-iron skillet, combine the garlic and olive oil and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is very fragrant and just starts to brown, 8 to  10 minutes.
Add the chile and smoked paprika and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 15 to 30 seconds.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring and turning the shrimp occasionally, until barely pink, about 5 minutes.

Stir in the parsley, sherry, lemon zest and a generous pinch of salt. Remove from the heat and let stand until the shrimp are cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes. Serve in the skillet, passing crusty bread at the table.

recipe.forked:
[Gambas al Ajillo ](http://www.foodandwine.com/recipes/gambas-al-ajillo),
[Sizzling Shrimp with Garlic (Gambas al Pil Pil)](https://www.williams-sonoma.com/recipe/sizzling-shrimp-with-garlic-gambas-al-pil-pil.html)

recipe.name: Shakshuka

step.description: Heat oil in a large, deep, preferably ceramic, frying pan on medium heat
Cook onions until translucent, 5-10 min
Add minced meat, stir until lightly browned
Reduce heat a little, add jalapeño and bell pepper, cook until slightly soft. 3-4 min, do not overcook
Add garlic and tomato concentrate, stir for 2 min until tomato tastes cooked not raw
Add the wine. Tip: pour the wine into the tomato paste jar and shake it to get the last of the paste out.

Add canned tomatoes, cumin, caraway seeds, bay leaves, paprika, erythritol, concentrated stock, and pepper. Yes, that is a lot of cumin; it will be fine. Bring to low boil, reduce heat, simmer for 20 min
Place de-stemmed Swiss chard leaves on top of cooked tomato mixture. Make 8 small depressions with a spoon
Crack one egg into each depression. Cover (a transparent lid is ideal)
Cook until egg white is _just_ set. Serve immediately, in the pan.

recipe.notes:
- The tomato sauce keeps for a couple of days in the fridge. If eating over two days, crack only 4 eggs. Next time, reheat sauce then make 4 more depressions and crack the other 4.
- We use Sukrin Gold erythritol, which looks and tastes like light brown sugar. If not low-carbing, demarara or other sugar can be substituted.
- Bell peppers are bad for absorbing pesticides, so we always use organic because the skin is eaten.
- The type of red wine is not critical, honestly. We use small (187ml) “individual” bottles of fairly cheap red wine.

recipe.name: Real Caesar Salad
recipe.description: Based on the original 1920's Italian-American table-side recipe

step.description: Traditionally using a mortar and pestle (but a hand blender works just as well, we find) turn the garlic, anchovies and a pinch of salt into a fine paste.
Add the whisked egg yolks, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and mustard. This can be done in a bowl with a whisk, or if using a blender continue with that.
Gradually at first, add the oil and whisk/blend with each addition.
Add the Parmesan and mix well.
Taste, adjust with salt, pepper, lemon as desired.
Either shred the romaine hearts and toss with the sauce, or serve individual leaves for dipping.
If liked, garnish with more whole anchovies and/or Parmesan flakes

recipe.notes:
We don't use croutons but if you want them, go ahead!
Sauce keeps well in a fridge for a few days.

recipe.name: Fathead Pineapple Pizza

step.description: Mix two thirds of the grated mozzarella, the almond flour, and the nutritional yeast in a microwaveable bowl. Add the mascarpone. Microwave on HIGH for 1 minute.
Add cumin, garlic, salt, pepper.
Stir then microwave on HIGH for another minute. Repeat until it's soft, usually doesn’t need more than 2 minutes total.
Add the eggs and mix gently.

Put a piece of parchment paper over your pizza stone, add the dough on top of it and then another piece of parchment paper. Use a rolling pin to roll it as close as possible to the pizza stone shape and evenly around 5mm thick or less. Remove the top sheet of parchment paper.
Make fork holes all over the pizza base to ensure it cooks evenly.
Bake at 215C/420F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
If you can manage to flip the pizza over without breaking it, flip it and bake a bit longer to make it crispy. If you’re worried it will break don't flip it, we never do and it’s fine!

While the base is baking, make the tomato sauce: in a mini-blender of food processor blend the tomato paste, garlic wine, basil, Worcestershire sauce, oregano. Cook at medium-low heat for 5-10 minutes or until thickened a bit.
While the base is baking and the sauce simmering, cut the bacon into 5mm lardons and sauté with the mushrooms until almost (but not completely) cooked to your liking.

Once the pizza base is done, spread the sauce over it as evenly as you can (a brush or rubber spatula helps). Then add the remaining grated cheeses, the bacon, the mushrooms, the pepper, the pineapple.
Broil at 260C/500F for about 5 minutes, checking frequently because ovens vary. Enjoy!

recipe.forked: [Fat Head Pizza - The HOLY GRAIL Of Low Carb Pizzas ](https://www.ditchthecarbs.com/fat-head-pizza/)

recipe.name: Garlic mushrooms a la crème with lardons and green pepper
recipe.description: Not the most photogenic dish, but really easy, quick and delicious!

step.description: Cut each strip of bacon into 4mm [lardons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lardon).
Fry the bacon in the butter on medium-high heat until starting to turn translucent
Add sliced mushrooms. Season with black pepper.
Continue to fry until mushrooms release their liquid and are turning darker.
In a separate pan, fry the pepper in the coconut oil until softened and just starting to turn brown.
Add garlic to the mushrooms and stir until fragrant.
Add thyme and stir. Then add a generous splash of Worcestershire sauce.
Pour the cream into the mushrooms, bring to a low boil, then reduce heat.
Add the green peppers
When the cream reduces a bit, add the grated cheese and stir until melted.
Grate the nutmeg into the mixture and serve.

recipe.notes:
- If you can find smoked cheddar, use a mixture of 50% smoked cheddar and 50% normal cheddar (it's very strong so not 100%). 
- Don’t allow the cream to overcook or it will separate!
- You can probably cook the pepper in with the mushrooms and ignore the coconut oil, if desired.

recipe.name: Chicken Liver Pâté
recipe.description: Rich and creamy, delicious on bread or even on its own

step.description: Chop most of the onion but set a little aside for garnish
Sauté garlic and onion in a bit of butter.
Add the livers and sauté on both sides until they have a bit color but are still pink inside. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the Metaxa and let it steam away.
Put all in a tall blender glass and add the cream and remaining butter and blend until smooth
Put aside in fridge for at least 4 hours and serve, garnishing with the balsamic reduction, parsley and the onion from step 1.

recipe.forked: Original recipe by Lea Dam Jensen

recipe.name: Octopus in Wine

step.description: Wash the octopus, remove the eyes and beak, and separate the tentacles. Cut each tentacle in 2-3 pieces of roughly equal volume, same for the head.
Put tentacles and head in a large pot with nothing else and boil over medium heat.
You will notice that the octopus is releasing juices and slowly become redder. As the juices start to evaporate, slowly pour the wine.
Once you've poured all wine, add cloves and bay leaves.
Simmer for about two hours. Half an hour before done, add the potatoes or turnips and the olives.
Once it's reduced and the octopus and vegetables are tender add 1tbsp olive oil, mix, and serve! Makes about 6 portions.

recipe.notes:
The original version uses potatoes, but we have used turnips, okra and other vegetables with good success. Turnips also make the dish low carb. The one in the photo uses okra.
Χταπόδι κρασάτο is the Greek name.
recipe.forked: [Χταπόδι κρασάτο: ξεχωριστός μεζές με τρία μόνο υλικά!](https://www.cretangastronomy.gr/2013/04/%CF%87%CF%84%CE%B1%CF%80%CF%8C%CE%B4%CE%B9-%CE%BA%CF%81%CE%B1%CF%83%CE%AC%CF%84%CE%BF-%CE%BE%CE%B5%CF%87%CF%89%CF%81%CE%B9%CF%83%CF%84%CF%8C%CF%82-%CE%BC%CE%B5%CE%B6%CE%AD%CF%82-%CE%BC%CE%B5-%CF%84-2/)

recipe.name: Sous Vide Salmon Teriyaki
recipe.description: Tender, refreshing and very easy to make

step.description: In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the soy sauce, erythritol, ginger, garlic, mirin and sesame oil. Bring to a simmer, stirring until the erythritol has dissolved, about 1 minute. Let cool to room temperature. Reserve 1/4 cup (2 fl. oz./60 ml) of the sauce.
Place the salmon fillets in separate zip lock bags and pour the remaining sauce into the bags, dividing evenly. If you have time you can let them marinate for 1-4 hours, but you don’t have to.

Prepare a sous vide immersion circulator for use according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Preheat the water to 122°F (50°C). Place the bags into the circulating water and cook for 40 minutes for medium doneness.
5 minutes before the salmon is done, stir fry the bean sprouts in a large pan with a tsp of sesame oil and a splash of soy sauce. Divide evenly in two plates.

Once the salmon is done, sear the skin in the same pan for 30 seconds. Place each fillet on top of the bean sprouts and pour the saved sauce on it. Optionally, you can also use the sauce from the ziplock bags, but keep in mind it will be more watery (we did anyway).
Garnish with the sliced spring onion and serve!

recipe.notes: Not low carbing? You can use brown sugar in place of erythritol.

recipe.name: Sfouggato
recipe.description: A Lesbian delicacy that is super easy to make and can be eaten hot or cold.

step.description: Add a lot of salt to the grated zucchini and squeeze well with a towel or cheesecloth to remove moisture.
Beat the eggs in a bowl and set aside.
In a large bowl, mix the zucchini, parsley, dill, onion, spring onion, cheeses, pepper, eggs.
Add the olive oil to the mix.
Spread on a deep, oiled baking tray and bake at 180-200C (350-390F) for about 40 minutes or until golden.

recipe.notes:
- Graviera is a Greek hard light yellow cheese. Can’t find graviera? Use any yellow cheese that melts. The sfouggato in this photo was actually made with cheddar!
- Don’t have all the ingredients? Worry not! This is a dish with many variations. Most of the ingredients are optional. What is absolutely mandatory is the eggs, zucchinis, some herbs (parsley, dill, and/or mint), some kind of cheese, and some kind of onion (only red onion or only spring onion is ok).

recipe.name: Khoresht Karafs
recipe.description: A delicious Persian stew with beef and celery.

step.description: Wash the mint and parsley and make sure they are *completely dry*. A salad spinner helps, if you don’t have one you can use paper towels.
Finely chop the mint and parsley, then sauté until just starting to turn crispy. Set aside.
Sauté the onion with enough butter or oil until golden
Add the garlic and sauté for 1-2 more minutes
Add the turmeric and sauté for 2 more minutes
Add the beef cubes and sauté until browned on the outside
Pour in the beef stock and sautéed mint and parsley and simmer
In a separate pan, sauté the celery until *just* starting to turn brown. Set aside.
After the stew has been simmering for 1.5 hour, pour in the sautéed celery and simmer for another 30 minutes. This is done so that the celery doesn’t become too mushy.
Finish with the lemon juice and serve.

recipe.name: No-Bake Strawberry Cheesecake

step.description: **Base:** Lightly toast the almond flour and coconut flour, then add the butter and stir until it melts, then vanilla, cinnamon and Sukrin Gold to taste. Once the mixture is even, press into a 9" springform cake tray. Let it cool down, ideally in the fridge.

**Cream**: With a mixer beat the mascarpone on its own for a bit, then slowly add icing erythritol to taste, then the rest of the ingredients. Blend until even, then spread over the base in the cake tray. Put it back in the fridge.

**Topping**: Blend half of the strawberries and cut the other half into slices. Using a small pot, heat up the blended strawberries, erythritol to taste, lemon juice and stir frequently until all heated up and mixed well, then add the sliced strawberries and stir until heated. Add the gelatin or pectin (read the instructions, each one works differently), stir well and let it cool down. Once it starts getting viscous, spread it over the cream and put it back in the fridge.
Chill in the fridge for at least 3 hours, then enjoy!

recipe.notes: - Not low carbing? You can substitute Sukrin Gold for brown sugar and Icing erythritol for — you guessed it — icing sugar.

recipe.name: Curried Beef Stew
recipe.description: Spicy, complex, and very flavorful, this Thai-inspired curry is perfect for cold winter nights.

ingredient.name: lemongrass stalk
ingredient.preparation: bottom 4" only, tough outer layer removed, cut into 1" pieces

step.description: **Curry paste**: In a mini blender or food processor, blend chiles and salt until pulverized. Add lemongrasss, ginger, galangal, turmeric, chopped shallots, garlic, shrimp paste one by one in order listed, fully pulverizing each before adding the next.

Combine curry paste, beef, soy sauce, and ground chipotle in a pot; stir to evenly coat beef. Add coconut oil and cook, stirring occasionally, over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until beef is tender but not falling apart, 2-2 1/2 hours.
30 minutes before stew is done, stir in the turnip.
5 minutes before stew is done, add the halved shallots.
Garnish with cilantro and basil.
